metadata.title: CVE-2024-5689 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In addition to detecting when a user was taking a screenshot (XXX), awebsite was able to overlay the 'My Shots' button that appeared, and directthe user to a replica Firefox Screenshots page that could be used forphishing. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-5689` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 127.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 127.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 127.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '127.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
